analyzed: gnyis sam / de'i nang nas bslab pa'i gzhi gcig tsam la'ang bslab par bya'o //

analyzed: lhod pa dang / yang ba'i sems dang / don gyi dbang dang / dgos pa'i dbang gis spyad par bya ste /

analyzed: kun tu spyad par 'dod pa na'ang rnam par smad par bya /

original: spyod cing 'dug pa na'ang rnam par smad par bya /
analyzed: spyod cing 'dug pa na'ang rnam par smad par bya /
translated: Even if you are engaging in it and staying with it, you should condemn it.

original: rnam @224b par bshung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam @224b par bshung bar bya'o //
translated: You should expose it.

original: spyad zin pa na'ang rnam par smad par bya /
analyzed: spyad zin pa na'ang rnam par smad par bya /

original: rnam par bshung bar bya'o //🔽so sor bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshung bar bya'o // so sor bshags par bya'o //

original: nges par 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar bya'o //

original: legs pa dge ba ci'ang rung ba zhig kun tu spyod pa na ni des ni de la sems zhen pa dang / drag po'i sems dang / tshim pa dang / mgu ba dang / lhod pa ma yin pa dang / yang ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: legs pa dge ba ci'ang rung ba zhig kun tu spyod pa na ni des ni de la sems zhen pa dang / drag po'i sems dang / tshim pa dang / mgu ba dang / lhod pa ma yin pa dang / yang ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: When one is engaged in any wholesome, virtuous conduct, one should do so with a mind that is attached to it, a mind that is intense, a mind that is satisfied, a mind that is pleased, a mind that is not lax, a mind that is not loose,

analyzed: kun tu spyod par 'dod pa na'ang snying thag pa rus pa'i khong nas yid la byas te /
translated: When one wishes to engage in conduct, one should do so with a mind that is attentive, with a mind that is intent, with a mind that is focused, with a mind that is concentrated, with a mind that is intent on the essence, with a mind that is intent on the marrow.

original: sems can thams cad kyis bsams nas sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir dang / dgrol ba'i phyir dang / dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir dang /

translated: Having reflected on all sentient beings, he should dedicate [his virtue] to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment for the sake of liberating all sentient beings, for the sake of freeing them, for the sake of comforting them, for the sake of their complete nirvāṇa, for the sake of attaining omniscience,

translated: and for the sake of perfecting all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: des dge ba kun tu spyod pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba thams cad la'ang snying thag pa rus pa'i khong nas yid la byas te /
analyzed: des dge ba kun tu spyod pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba thams cad la'ang snying thag pa rus pa'i khong nas yid la byas te /
translated: Having reflected on all his past, future, and present virtuous practices,

original: sems can thams cad kyis bsams nas mngon par bsdus te bzlums nas rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis bsams nas mngon par bsdus te bzlums nas rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //

analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i mchog dang / @225a *//

translated: Having rejoiced, one should offer that virtuous practice to all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and śrāvakas.

original: phul nas kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du bya zhing sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir dang / dgrol ba'i phyir dang / dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: phul nas kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du bya zhing sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir dang / dgrol ba'i phyir dang / dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: Having offered it, he should dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening three times each day, sharing it with all sentient beings, for the sake of liberating all sentient beings, for the sake of freeing them, for the sake of comforting them, for the sake of their complete nirvāṇa, for the sake of their completing all buddhadharmas,

translated: and for the sake of their attaining omniscience.

translated: Their minds will become loose, weak, small, thin, and insignificant with regard to the performance of negative and nonvirtuous actions.

original: gsog tu 'gyur /

translated: They will become attached, strong, firm, and not weak or small with regard to the performance of virtuous actions.

original: dang; 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang; 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi sdug bsngal gcad par bya ba dang /

translated: They have entered the path to cut, block, and pacify those sufferings. They have a loving mind, a mind of great compassion, and they are clad in great armor. They have entered the Great Vehicle.

translated: In this way, the beginner bodhisattva gradually diminishes unwholesome, non-virtuous conduct in this life, future lives, and other rebirths through this sequence.
